refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Tgtd is a SCSI Target daemon. It can be used to provide SCSI target service to a network. The most common service is iSCSI but other services are also supported.

refsect1.title: Device types
refsect1.para: Tgtd provides support for both emulated and passthrough of real devices.

refentry.screen:
Tgtd can emulate the following types of devices:
disk : Normal disk device. Emulates a SCSI harddisk. tape : Tape device. Emulates a SCSI tape drive. cd : CD device. Emulates a SCSI DVD burner. changer : Media changer. Emulate the changer device for a virtual tape library or DVD jukebox.

refsect1.title: ISCSI options
refsect1.para: These parameters apply only to the iSCSI frontend.

refsect2.title: portal=<ip-address[:port]>
refsect2.para: This option is used to bind tgtd to a specific ip-address/portal and/or port. By default tgtd will bind to port 3260 on the wildcard address. The ip-address part (before the ":") can be missing to designate the wildcard address with a none-default port.

Example: to bind tgtd to a specific address and port
tgtd --iscsi portal=192.0.2.1:3260
Example: to bind tgtd to any address but a none-default port
tgtd --iscsi portal=:3251

refsect2.title: nop_interval=<integer>
refsect2.para: This sets the default interval for sending NOP-OUT to probe for connected initiators. This parameter only controls the default value for targets. Individual targets can be controlled using tgtadm.
The default value is 0 which means that the feature is disabled TGTD will not send any NOP-OUT probes.

refsect2.title: nop_count=<integer>
refsect2.para: This sets the default value for after how many failed probes TGTD will consider the initiator dead and tear down the session. This parameter only controls the default value for targets. Individual targets can be controlled using tgtadm.

Example: send NOP-OUT every 5 seconds and abort the session after 6 failures.
tgtd --iscsi portal=192.0.2.1:3260,nop_interval=5,nop_count=6
